abstract: The agency said it would examine Epogen, Aranesp and Procrit after a clinical trial suggested that high doses might cause strokes.
snippet: The agency said it would examine Epogen, Aranesp and Procrit after a clinical trial suggested that high doses might cause strokes.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said Wednesday that it would review of the safety of the widely used anemia drugs sold by Amgen and Johnson & Johnson after another clinical trial suggested that high doses of one of the drugs might cause strokes.

headline.main: F.D.A. Plans Safety Check of 3 Drugs for Anemia
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Plans Safety Check Of 3 Drugs For Anemia
